channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: @lavietidhar Or at least of the world.
A question for Yiddishist / linguists / Jewish journalists: When someone uses a Yeshivish word like "achrayus," should it be described as "Hebrew" or "Yiddish"?
Would be interesting to see the overlap between those damning @IfNotNowOrg as “traitors״ and those promoting the various Black Republican Zionists. https://t.co/f1ukqGcdlC
@kampeas Editors publish the pieces their publishers want them to publish.
@jamesdnicoll Translated from which language?
@EladNehorai If only we had a book of the Bibi’s with the theme of ever again. Maybe we could read it on Sukkot.
@gorskon @MarkHoofnagle Early in my parenting days, I ran across a similar sentiment, translated from a 3000 year old tablet.

Worth noting how the bothsiderism of the Times I criticize in its political coverage plays out in another field. https://t.co/JOMCTY7SQv
The fact is that outside of investigations, the Times doesn’t want to be the arbiter of truth.
@joshtpm @TPM So what world you do if you were the judge?
@jamesdnicoll Say more!

@AkivaMCohen Having done some Googling for a friend forced to do pro se legal work, I do appreciate the possibility of confusion. However, this would seem to open her up to a malpractice suit from famously litigious client.

As usual, @swordsjew has the receipts of the latest Republican effort to foment violence against liberals while enabling their own predation of children in the name of "Christian family values." https://t.co/BFj7hiCQVO

@antumbral @thedextriarchy Jason Todd is not amused.
@antumbral @thedextriarchy https://t.co/7FEJtG0Eun
@TheRaDR Tablet is also complicit in spreading covid and Trumpist conspiracy theories.
@RJELevi 'tis the season for seasonal photo sessions. https://t.co/1vlvAsFzmo
@HannahLebovits They might want to peruse the lawsuits against YU and the OU that are winding their way through the court system before throwing stones at JOFA.
@RJELevi Not my photo but sweet, in an unleavened way. https://t.co/4qiprZFsog
@DIguanadon @AkivaMCohen Gut everything down to the supporting walls. Lay new pipes in the floor. Nobody's putting gas lines in new kitchens these days.
@TheRaDR And the name of that servant? George Harrison. https://t.co/Bq32szpBd8

@bernstein_judah Oddly, Orthodox communal leaders have gotten decreasingly wise about such matters over the decades.
@bernstein_judah Of course, if leaders are raised on books like this, it’s no surprise. https://t.co/5w7Z7Ec89D
Maxwell House aimed small in getting a hechsher on their coffee beans. They should have gotten rabbinic approval to do as the below tweet suggests. https://t.co/N2tcpjkC2T
@ParkerMolloy @AstroKatie That’s what dental records are for. And subcutaneous chips.

@AstroKatie @ParkerMolloy I flip between the two modes of “gender is nobody’s business except on dating apps” and “gender is fine but please don’t ask me to remember yours; I need the brain space to remember where I parked my car.”

@BluehairCoffee @euthyphro People don’t like being made uncomfortable by the papers they own, read, or advertise in. So as the truth gets more uncomfortable to people whose identity is tied up in being Conservative, there will be less truth in rye paper.
